poem:
### The Absence

In the quiet  
between touch,  
a longing grows—  
six months of  
unspoken words,  
a garden left  
untended.

Yet roots are  
deep, faithful  
to the earth,  
waiting in  
stillness, beneath  
regret's late shadow.

The bloom awaits,  
in its season,  
to burst anew,  
unfolding petals  
of hidden promise  
in love's brief  
returning dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This is how we do it: ‘When we do have sex it’s the best, but it hasn’t happened for six months’ Henry, 41 We have the option to play away, but I don’t want to experience that intimacy with anybody else Luis and I met on Grindr 12 years ago, just after he’d moved to the UK and I’d split up with my ex-husband. The last time we had sex was about six months ago,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
